hero.title: Brew Your Future: Master the Art of Coffee
hero.subtitle: From bean to cup, and from training to employment. Join Rwanda’s premier training center to gain world-class barista skills and the career support you need to succeed.

benefits.title: Why Choose Usafi Barista Training Center?
benefits.subtitle: We offer more than just a certificate; we offer a pathway to a career.

item1.title: Comprehensive Curriculum
item1.description: Learn from industry experts like Sandrine Gasarasi and Ishimwe Ebenezer. Our curriculum covers everything from Espresso & Milk techniques to Coffee Shop Business management, ensuring you are ready for the market.

item2.title: Flexible Learning Options
item2.description: Study on your own terms. Choose our Onsite program in Kimironko for hands-on intensity, or our E-Learning platform to study theory from anywhere at your own pace.

item3.title: Real Career Support
item3.description: We don't just teach; we connect. Gain access to exclusive internship opportunities at top local hotels and cafés, job alerts via the Usafi Community, and professional interview preparation.

hero.title: Cultivating Coffee Excellence in Rwanda.
hero.description: Located in the heart of Kimironko, Usafi Barista Training Center is more than just a school; it is a launchpad for careers in the hospitality industry. We bridge the gap between passion and profession, providing aspiring baristas with the technical skills, business knowledge, and confidence needed to thrive in the world of coffee.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.description: To empower individuals with world-class barista skills and practical business knowledge, connecting them to sustainable employment and entrepreneurship opportunities within the growing coffee industry.

vision.title: Our Vision
vision.description: To become the premier destination for coffee education in Rwanda, raising the standard of service and coffee quality across the region.

leadership.title: Meet the Experts Behind Your Training

director.name: Sandrine Gasarasi
director.description: As the driving force behind Usafi, Sandrine represents a commitment to quality and student success. Under her leadership, the center focuses not only on making the perfect cup of coffee but on shaping the character and work ethic of professional baristas.

mentorship.title: Expert Mentorship
mentorship.description: Our training team, led by experienced professionals like Ishimwe Ebenezer, brings years of industry experience directly to the classroom. They don't just teach theory; they share real-world insights, techniques, and the secrets of the trade that you won't find in textbooks.

represent.title: What We Represent
represent.description: "Usafi" stands for cleanliness, purity, and excellence. We represent a new generation of baristas who understand that coffee is an art form. From hygiene and safety to advanced latte art, our students graduate ready to work in top-tier cafés, hotels, and restaurants.

curriculum.title: Comprehensive Module Breakdown
curriculum.description: Whether you study Online or Onsite, our curriculum covers the essential pillars of the coffee industry.

m1.title: Introduction to Coffee
m1.description: History of coffee, bean varieties (Arabica vs. Robusta), and processing methods.

m2.title: Barista Basics & Equipment
m2.description: Understanding the espresso machine, grinder calibration, and tamping techniques.

m3.title: Espresso & Milk Science
m3.description: Perfecting the espresso shot (extraction) and mastering milk steaming (micro-foam).

m4.title: Latte Art
m4.description: Techniques for pouring hearts, rosettas, and tulips.

m5.title: Hygiene & Maintenance
m5.description: Machine cleaning protocols and workspace safety standards.

m6.title: Customer Service
m6.description: Building customer loyalty, body language, and service adaptation.

m7.title: Bonus: Coffee Shop Business
m7.description: Business planning, menu pricing, marketing, and startup tips.

inclusion.subtitle: Commitment to Inclusion and Adaptation
inclusion.description: Usafi Barista Training Center believes that passion for coffee knows no limits. We are committed to fostering an inclusive learning environment and adapting our curriculum to ensure accessibility and success for all students, including those with disabilities.

hearing.title: For Students Who Cannot Hear & Speak
list: Visual-First Instruction: Heavy reliance on visual demonstrations, written step-by-step procedures, and clear diagrams for practical modules.
Communication Tools: Whiteboards, digital tablets, and written communication for immediate Q&A.
Peer Support: Partnership with hearing peers for seamless teamwork.

list: Ergonomics Review: Guidance on adaptive tools and workspace modifications (e.g., lower counters).
Safety First: Physical assistance during heavy-lifting tasks or maintenance.

equipment.title: The Right Tools for the Job
equipment.subtitle: Essential Equipment for Your Professional Coffee Setup
equipment.description: Starting a coffee shop requires more than just passion—it requires the right gear. This guide covers the foundational tools needed to ensure efficiency, quality, and consistency, whether you're setting up a full-scale café or a small espresso bar.

espresso.title: Espresso Machine
espresso.subtitle: The heart of your business.
espresso.description: Choose based on volume needs (single-group vs. multi-group). A reliable machine delivers consistent pressure and temperature for the perfect extraction every time.

grinder.title: Coffee Grinder
grinder.subtitle: As important as the machine itself.
grinder.description: A quality grinder ensures uniform particle size for perfect extraction. Inconsistent grinds lead to uneven flavor and wasted beans.

tamper.title: Tamper
tamper.description: Ensures a level and compacted coffee bed for even extraction. Calibrated tampers recommended for consistency.

pitcher.title: Milk Pitcher
pitcher.description: Stainless steel required for steaming milk. Have various sizes (350ml, 600ml) for different drink orders.

knock.title: Knock Box
knock.description: Used for disposing of used coffee pucks cleanly. Must be durable (stainless steel/rubber) and easy to wash.

scales.title: Digital Scales
scales.description: Precision is vital. Used for dosing grounds accurately and measuring extraction yield by weight.

cups.title: Cups & Glasses
cups.description: Ceramic mugs for dine-in. Demitasse for espresso. Insulated, eco-friendly cups for takeaway.

storage.title: Inventory Storage
storage.description: Airtight containers/hoppers to keep roasted beans fresh and away from moisture.

pos.title: Point of Sale (POS)
pos.description: Essential software for managing orders, tracking sales patterns, and accepting payments.

node_modules.title: Cleaning Kit
node_modules.description: Dedicated kit for daily back-flushing, group head scrubbing, and steam wand cleaning.

agents.title: Specialized Agents
agents.description: Use only approved food-grade detergents and descaling chemicals safe for your machine.

gear.title: Safety Gear
gear.description: First aid kit immediately accessible. Non-slip floor mats behind the bar.
